title: Those Nidalee Nerfs are Nerfing Laning Phase Nidalee and not Jungle Nidalee
body:
Like seriously the problem is jungle Nidalee is out of control, I used to main nidalee, but this nerf is a joke. Its nerfing laning phase nidalee, and it doesn't change anything to Jungle Nidalee.

Most Jungle Nidalee players Build ROA making this nerf non-existent. You need to change something else about her, instead of just nerfing her base stats. 

Pretty much all you did now was force Nidalee in the Jungle Role. The base HP nerf + hp/level nerf will cause her  to have a terrible time in laning phase. Only Place for her now is the Jungle. 

TLDR; Nidalee Laning Phase is much more difficult, Jungle Nidalee is now the Recommended Choice*

No. She doesn't. She's a poke-based champion with high mobility to try to engage on a target she has already poked or attempt to escape an all-in. Adding a heal on top of that makes sure that, after she has some mana sustain (blue buff, chalice, morello, etc), you damn near can't kill her if you have no hard lockdown. You remember that old bullshit adage "just CC them", right? Well, not every champ has CC, and so that should mean that Nidalee essentially has a free pass against them? Obviously she will counter some champions, just as some counter her, but currently her heal serves to minimize the damage of her counters while exacerbating her strengths against people she herself counters. 

Not only that, but even if she doesn't need the heal herself she can use it on other people, so that they get healed for 45/85/125/165/205 (+50% AP)  in addition to gaining up to 20/30/40/50/60% attack speed (Source: http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Nidalee ) So if she doesn't need the heal, she can pass it on as a life-saving tool for someone else on her team, or use it as a straight-up AS steroid for her carry, or whoever else is nearby that does well with high attack speed (Diana, for instance).

She could use some form of sustain, certainly. I don't see why not. But make it have some form of interaction beyond "lol I clicked someone and healed them for ridiculous numbers while giving them a large AS steroid." Hell, let it keep the AS, but force the target to AA for smaller heals over the duration of a buff. Anything but an interaction-less heal on a long-range escape artist. Viktor has to AA for maximum damage, Ziggs has to AA for maximum damage, Lux has to AA for maximum damage, Xerath has to get up close and hit something for some form of mana sustain. Why? Because they're long-ranged and hard to interact with if you don't or can't force some kind of interaction. Why should Nidalee have next to no interaction while keeping her silly heal, long-ranged poke and all-in power if a spear hits?

You might think I hate Nidalee, and you'd be right. But the ability I hate the most isn't her nuclear spears. Those used to be far worse. They're fine now. Her all in is fine. Her mobility is fine. All of that is fine, IF she didn't have sustain that also had no real interaction. None of her skills have any real interaction with the enemy beyond them dodging past the laning phase until she lands a spear and goes all Thundercat on their faces.

"Because you said she does" is not valid evidence or a supporting argument unless you're either a) an employee of Riot's balance team, and well, you're not; or b) one of the creators of Nidalee's kit, which you're definitely not. And even then, they'd explain their thought process behind why her heal is necessary in its current state so as to prevent this squabbling crap, and perhaps take some constructive criticism of the kit (or flak, as is the case in a lot of the boards). 

You have provided no evidence of why she needs her heal in her current state. Your one argument I've seen so far is "When you get better, you'll understand why she needs it," which is already bullshit because people of all ranks pretty routinely complain about Nidalee, and if they aren't complaining they're still riding on her coattails to success. Not only that, her win rate appears to actually be at its highest in the higher rankings, with no real falloff at the lower rankings, minimizing itself at about 47% on bad days, and seeming to average out around 48-50% even in Bronze, while being 47-60% on any given day in Platinum or higher. 

Her kit has no real interaction beyond dodging spears until she lands one, at which point she, as I said, goes Cougar and mauls you to give you a brief window of time to respond. Unfortunately, your response is hampered by the fact you just took a nuke, and are about to take another one. Then she leaves and heals up and you can do nothing about it unless you have massive sustain of your own. The only saving grace against her is that her teamfighting is abysmal because hit and run tactics don't tend to work all that well against a deathball (e.g. Teemo)
